name: Eternal Seas
description:
Eternal Seas is a gameplay demonstration that features an interactive story, third person open world exploration, and (naval) combat.

Take command as captain of your own pirate ship in the fictitious island region of Odora. As captain you might find that a pirate’s loyalty can be a…  flexible matter.  

Mortal adversaries aren’t your only concern however, the seas hide a threat far greater than an ill-tempered crew.


"What do you think you’re doing!? Is it normal to rob sleeping people where you come from?"

- An Angry Skeleton

Credits

  • Vincent Versnel - Programmer

Special thanks to Arjen Wester for the UI art /voice acting, and to Marjan Veen, Martin Veen, and Delano Goosen for voice acting.

Future

Eternal Seas was made primarily to sharpen our skills in game development and explore a game idea we had for a few years. We would love to hear your feedback (good and bad!), and let us know in the comments if you want this to turn into a full release! This demo is only scratching the surface of what we have in mind...

Feedback
  • First Impressions
  • [Story]: Did you feel connected to any of the characters? Were you interested in the continuation of the story?
  • [Exploration]: Did you feel that it was a rich experience? Did you feel that you could explore things?
  • [Combat]: Was the sword/gun play satisfying? How difficult was the combat?
  • [Naval]: Did you enjoy sailing?
  • Would you purchase the full-version of this game? (~10 euros for 7-15 hours of gameplay)
